description:
The  rollout of COVID-19 AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccines will begin on Thursday 15 April 2021. The rollout will be implemented according to priority groups, this is due to limited vaccines available worldwide. The Ministry intends to first vaccinate frontline workers including staff from the Health Ministry, Tonga Police, His Majesty’s Armed Forces, Tonga Fire and Emergency Services, ports and airport staff. 

The COVID-19 AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccines will arrive at Fua’amotu Airport today Wednesday 31 March 2021, at approximately 1pm.

The Ministry of Health aims for all frontliners to be vaccinated over the next three days. This is a total of 2,200 staff including healthcare workers. The second priority group is over 45s as well as individuals over 18 with Non-Communicable diseases or disabilities.

All licensed businesses and business activities shall be closed except supermarkets and retail shops selling essential needs and those services which are deemed as essential such as pharmacies, healthcare and important infrastructure.

All liquor licensed bars, restaurants, night clubs, retail bottle shops and liquor manufacturers shall be closed.

Kava clubs, bingo, sports clubs, gyms, sporting events shall be prohibited.

These restrictions begin on March 29 and will end April 5 2020. UPDATE: The restrictions on non essential businesses was set to last until April 12, it has been extended to April 17 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
